paper_abstract: In this article, a tractable modus operandi is proposed to model a (binary) digital image (i.e., an image defined on a"currency sign (n) and equipped with a standard pair of adjacencies) as an image defined in the space () of cubical complexes. In particular, it is shown that all the standard pairs of adjacencies (namely the (4,8) and (8,4)-adjacencies in a"currency sign(2), the (6,18), (18,6), (6,26), and (26,6)-adjacencies in a"currency sign(3), and more generally the (2n,3 (n) -1) and (3 (n) -1,2n)-adjacencies in a"currency sign (n) ) can then be correctly modelled in . Moreover, it is established that the digital fundamental group of a digital image in a"currency sign (n) is isomorphic to the fundamental group of its corresponding image in , thus proving the topological correctness of the proposed approach. From these results, it becomes possible to establish links between topology-oriented methods developed either in classical digital spaces (a"currency sign (n) ) or cubical complexes (), and to potentially unify some of them.
paper_title: Digital Imaging: A Unified Topological Framework
